Token Utility & Purpose â€‹

WLC is the native asset of the WorldLand mainnet and serves multiple critical functions within the ecosystem.

Four Pillars of Utility â€‹

1. PoW Mining Rewards â€‹

WLC is issued as rewards for Proof-of-Work mining, securing the WorldLand network.

ParameterValue
Block Reward20 WLC per block
Block Time10 seconds
Daily Issuance~172,800 WLC
Monthly Issuance~5,184,000 WLC
Block Reward Distribution:
â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
Miner:    80% (16 WLC)
Treasury: 20% (4 WLC)
â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”

Treasury Funding

A fixed 20% of each block reward flows to the Ecosystem Treasury, creating direct funding from chain security to long-term ecosystem development.

2. Transaction Fees (Gas) â€‹

WLC is used to pay gas fees for all on-chain transactions.

Fee-Required Actions â€‹

  • Job commitments
  • Challenge submissions
  • Settlement receipts
  • Governance actions
  • State modifications

Benefits of Gas â€‹

  • Spam Resistance - Prevents network abuse
  • Resource Pricing - Fair allocation of block space
  • Network Sustainability - Ongoing operational funding

3. Protocol Service Fees â€‹

WLC is the settlement currency for all protocol services.

Supported Services â€‹

ServiceDescription
GPU ComputeRent GPU resources for AI/ML workloads
StorageDecentralized storage services
Verification LayerProof verification services
AI InferenceRun inference on distributed GPUs
AI TrainingTrain models on the network

Payment Flow â€‹

Customer                    Protocol                    Provider

4. Governance â€‹

WLC holders participate in protocol governance.

Governance Scope â€‹

AreaExamples
Consensus ParametersECCVCC difficulty adjustment, block stability
Verification ParametersAudit rates, challenge windows, response deadlines
Fee PolicyGas pricing, service fee structures
Treasury PolicyBudget allocation, grants, security spending

Upgrade Policy â€‹

All protocol upgrades follow an on-chain governance process:

Proposal â†’ Review â†’ Vote â†’ Timelocked Activation
  • Parameter changes treated separately from code upgrades
  • Emergency actions narrowly scoped with post-incident ratification
  • Stakeholder time to evaluate and react to changes

Utility Summary â€‹

UtilityWho BenefitsFrequency
Mining RewardsMinersEvery block (10s)
Gas FeesAll usersEvery transaction
Service FeesCustomers & ProvidersPer service usage
GovernanceAll holdersPer proposal
